message.content:
cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SE 

The paper deals with the problem of constructing safe controllable regions for affine systems, which is a topic that is relevant to several areas of computer science. The most likely category is cs.SY (Systems and Control), which deals with the analysis and design of systems that can be modeled mathematically. The paper also has applications to robotics, which suggests that it could be classified under cs.RO (Robotics). Additionally, the paper proposes a computationally efficient algorithm, which could place it under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper deals with safety-critical systems, which could make it relevant to cs.SE (Software Engineering).
